channel.title: Bloomberg Technology
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: Coinbase Hackers Used Bribery in Scheme to Access Customer Data
item.description: Following cybersecurity best practices doesn’t always protect against human greed.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Stone

media:content.media:description: The Coinbase logo on a laptop computer arranged in Hastings-on-Hudson, New York, U.S., on Tuesday, Jan. 5, 2021. Coinbase Inc. knew cryptocurrency XRP was a security rather than a commodity and "illegally" sold Ripple Labs Inc.'s tokens anyway, a customer argues in a proposed class-action lawsuit over the commissions the crypto exchange collected.

item.title: FTC Rests at Meta Monopoly Trial, Shifting Focus to Defense
item.description: The Federal Trade Commission wrapped up its case Thursday for breaking up Meta Platforms Inc. as an illegal social-media monopoly, with the company now set to lay out its defense in the ongoing antitrust trial.
item.dc:creator: Josh Sisco

media:content.media:description: Mark Zuckerberg, chief executive officer of Meta Platforms Inc., arrives at federal court in Washington, DC, US, on Wednesday, April 16, 2025. The Federal Trade Commission alleges the acquisitions of Instagram in 2012 and WhatsApp in 2014 have given the company now known as Meta Platforms Inc. a social media monopoly, and is fighting to break up the company.

item.title: Apple Denies Blocking ‘Fortnite’ From EU Stores in Epic Dispute
item.description: Apple Inc. and Epic Games Inc. sparred over whether the iPhone maker was obstructing access to the hit game Fortnite, the latest tussle in a long-running feud over Apple’s control of game distribution revenue.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: The Epic Games Inc. Fortnite: Battle Royale video game is displayed for a photograph on an Apple Inc. iPhone in Washington, D.C., U.S., on Thursday, May 10, 2018. Fortnite, the hit game that's denting the stock prices of video-game makers after signing up 45 million players, didn't really take off until it became free and a free-for-all. Photographer: Andrew Harrer/Bloomberg

item.title: Coinbase Boosted by S&P 500 Inclusion Despite Hack, Probe Risks
item.description: Coinbase Global Inc.’s rally has been unconquerable this week, as even a one-two punch of negative headlines did little to stop the crypto exchange operator’s climb ahead of its inclusion in the S&P 500 Index.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Griffin

item.title: Coinbase Hackers Use Bribery to Grease the Wheels to Access Client Data
item.dc:creator: Jeff Stone

media:content.media:description: Brian Armstrong, chief executive officer of Coinbase Global Inc., speaks during a "Stand With Crypto" get out the vote rally at The Bourbon Room in Los Angeles, California, US, on Monday, March 4, 2024. California's Senate race is living up to its jungle primary nickname and turning out to be one of the most competitive in the nation, featuring crypto billionaire donors and a former star baseball player.

item.title: European Stocks Post Fifth Week of Gains as Trade Tensions Ease
item.description: European stocks wrapped up a fifth straight week of gains with investors focused on US trade negotiations, while the corporate earnings season has turned out better than expected.
item.dc:creator: Sagarika Jaisinghani

media:content.media:description: Stock prices on the trading floor of the Euronext NV stock exchange in Paris, France, on Tuesday, April 15, 2025. Stocks rose as US President Donald Trump floated a potential pause in auto tariffs, providing further relief to the market after he suspended levies on some consumer electronics. Photographer: Nathan Laine/Bloomberg

item.title: OpenAI Takes on Google, Anthropic With New AI Agent for Coders
item.description: OpenAI is rolling out a new artificial intelligence agent for ChatGPT users that’s designed to help streamline software development as the company pushes into a crowded market of startups and large tech firms offering AI tools for coders.
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: OpenAI on the Apple Safari app on a laptop arranged in Germantown, New York, US, on Wednesday, May 7, 2025. Apple Inc. is "actively looking at" revamping the Safari web browser on its devices to focus on AI-powered search engines, a seismic shift for the industry hastened by the potential end of a longtime partnership with Google.

item.title: Applied Materials Slides After Giving Disappointing Forecast
item.description: Applied Materials Inc. shares fell as much as 7.3% after the chip-equipment maker gave a lackluster forecast for the current period, highlighting the potential cost of the US trade dispute with China.
item.dc:creator: Ian King

media:content.media:description: Signage outside Applied Materials headquarters in Santa Clara, California, U.S., on Thursday, May 13, 2021. Applied Materials Inc. is expected to release earnings figures on May 20. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Premier League Sponsors Exit UK After Gaming Watchdog Probe
item.description: Six betting websites that sponsor UK Premier League football clubs have ceased their UK operations after an investigation by the country’s gambling regulator into their licensing partner.
item.dc:creator: Olivia Solon, David Hellier

media:content.media:description: Marcus Tavernier of Bournemouth in action.

item.title: Amazon Removed Backup Landing Sensors Before Drone Crashes
item.description: Retaining the technology could have prevented the aircraft from accidentally shutting off their propellers midflight and plummeting to the ground.
item.dc:creator: Matt Day

media:content.media:description: An Amazon MK30 delivery drone.

item.title: Ratos Weighs IPO of Nordic Construction Unit Sentia
item.description: Swedish conglomerate Ratos AB is considering listing its construction arm Sentia, according to people familiar with the matter, marking another potential initial public offering for the Nordic region.
item.dc:creator: Pablo Mayo Cerqueiro

media:content.media:description: A crane stands silhouetted at sunrise on a construction site at a Samsung Electronics Co. semiconductor plant in Pyeongtaek, Gyeonggi Province, South Korea, on Saturday, Oct. 27, 2018. Samsung is scheduled to release third-quarter earnings results on Oct. 31. Photographer: SeongJoon Cho/Bloomberg

item.title: Nvidia Shares Roar Back as Clouds Hanging Over Chipmaker Fade
item.description: After several months in the wilderness, Nvidia Corp. shares have found their way again as doubts about Big Tech spending subside, trade tensions with China ease, and new chip buyers emerge.
item.dc:creator: Jeran Wittenstein, Ryan Vlastelica

media:content.media:description: Nvidia Corp. signage during the Nvidia GPU Technology Conference (GTC) in San Jose, California, US, on Thursday, March 20, 2025. Nvidia Corp., whose products have fueled a flood of artificial intelligence spending, said new types of AI models that produce more complex answers will only increase the need for computing infrastructure.

item.title: Pinterest Is in Talks to Lease Offices at NYC’s 11 Madison Tower
item.description: Pinterest Inc. is in talks to take office space at Manhattan’s 11 Madison Ave.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Wong

media:content.media:description: A pedestrian walks past the Eleven Madison building in New York, U.S., on Tuesday, April 17, 2012. The Metropolitan Life North Building, now known as Eleven Madison, is a 30-story art deco skyscraper designed in the 1920s by Harvey Wiley Corbett and D. Everett Waid.

item.title: Lidar Maker Hesai Is Said to Confidentially File for Hong Kong Listing
item.description: China’s Hesai Group, the world’s largest maker of lidar sensors used in driver assistance systems, has confidentially filed for a Hong Kong listing, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Pei Li, Julia Fioretti, Amanda Wang

media:content.media:description: Cameras and lidar sensors on an Inceptio Technology autonomous truck in Jinan, Shandong Province, China, on Thursday, April 18, 2024. While most attention on the development of autonomous driving has focused on passenger cars — like Tesla's controversial Full Self-Driving — Chinese startup Inceptio Technology is concentrating on revolutionizing long-haul trucking. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg

item.title: TikTok Offers to Discuss Brazil Operations With Lula Government
item.description: Chinese social media platform TikTok is willing to talk about its Brazil operations with the South American country’s government, according to an official with knowledge of the matter, following a recent push for regulation by President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva and his wife.
item.dc:creator: Simone Iglesias

media:content.media:description: First Lady Rosangela da Silva and Brazil’s President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva

item.title: Charter Agrees to Combine With Cox in $34.5 Billion Deal
item.description: Charter Communications Inc. has agreed to combine with closely held Cox Communications in a cash-and-stock deal that would unite two of the biggest US cable providers.
item.dc:creator: Michelle F Davis

media:content.media:description: A Spectrum store in New York. Photographer: Angus Mordant/Bloomberg

item.title: Coinbase Hack Rocks Company That Led Crypto Into Mainstream
item.description: On the long list of crypto companies that have been hacked, there are plenty of examples of financial losses that are much more painful than what Coinbase Global Inc. appears to be facing from the attack it disclosed on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Margi Murphy, Emily Nicolle

media:content.media:description: The Coinbase website on a smartphone.

item.title: Vistra Makes AI Power Bet With $1.9 Billion Gas Plant Deal
item.description: Vistra Corp. agreed to buy seven natural gas-fired power plants for $1.9 billion, the latest big US generator betting on the fossil fuel to feed the voracious appetite of artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Mark Chediak, Naureen S Malik

media:content.media:description: Vapor rises from chimney's at a power plant. Photographer: Bloomberg Creative Photos/Bloomberg

item.title: French Producer Woos Hollywood With Epic That Inspired Game of Thrones
item.description: His godfather is Francis Ford Coppola and his family is French cinema royalty, but Dimitri Rassam says he’s carving his own path with plans to make a global blockbuster
item.dc:creator: Benoit Berthelot, Tom Fevrier

media:content.media:description: portrait of french producer DImitri Rassam in his office in Paris, 7th May 2025.

item.title: Are We Getting Too Close to Our Chatbots?
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ellen Huet reports on researchers’ growing concerns about our emotional entanglements with virtual friends.
item.dc:creator: Ellen Huet

media:content.media:description: A virtual friend displayed on the screen of an iPhone.

item.title: Why OpenAI Is Fueling the Arms Race It Once Warned Against
item.description: Two new books outline four reasons for OpenAI’s pivot away from its noncommercial origins.
item.dc:creator: Seth Fiegerman

item.title: America’s Leading Alien Hunters Depend on AI to Speed Their Search
item.description: Harvard’s Galileo Project has brought high-end academic research to a once-fringe pursuit, and the Pentagon is watching.
item.dc:creator: Jordan Robertson, Drake Bennett

media:content.media:description: In Massachusetts, the infrared camera array known as the Dalek is constantly scanning the sky.

item.title: Microsoft on Track to Dodge EU Antitrust Fines in Teams Probe
item.description: Microsoft Corp. is on track to dodge a hefty antitrust fine after European Union watchdogs said they’re seeking feedback on the US software giant’s offer to settle an investigation into illegal bundling of its Teams video-conferencing app.
item.dc:creator: Samuel Stolton

media:content.media:description: The Microsoft Teams app.

item.title: Trump’s Rush to Cut AI Deals in Saudi Arabia and UAE Opens Rift With China Hawks
item.description: President Donald Trump’s flurry of artificial intelligence deals during his tour of the Middle East is opening a rift within his own administration as China hawks grow increasingly concerned the projects are putting US national security and economic interests at risk.
item.dc:creator: Mackenzie Hawkins, Jenny Leonard

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman arrive at the Gulf Cooperation Council Leaders’ Summit in Riyadh on May 14.

item.title: South Africa Firm Paves Way to List Cell C Mobile-Phone Provider
item.description: Blue Label Telecoms Ltd. surged to the highest in almost seven years after it proposed a restructuring of its business to ultimately enable a listing of Cell C Ltd., South Africa’s fourth-largest wireless carrier.
item.dc:creator: Khuleko Siwele, Zinhle Xaba

media:content.media:description: A Cell C Ltd. advertisement billboard in Johannesburg. Photographer: Waldo Swiegers/Bloomberg

item.title: Alibaba’s Letdown Tempers the Outlook for China’s Tech Revival
item.description: China’s long-moribund tech sector started 2025 with a bang.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang, Claire Che, Luz Ding

item.title: Musk’s xAI Blames Rogue Tampering for ‘White Genocide’ Glitches
item.description: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence chatbot Grok blamed unsanctioned changes to its system for responses this week that included controversial theories about “white genocide” in South Africa.
item.dc:creator: Saritha Rai

media:content.media:description: The Grok logo on a smartphone arranged in New York, US, on Wednesday, Nov. 8, 2023. Elon Musk revealed his own artificial intelligence bot, dubbed Grok, claiming the prototype is already superior to ChatGPT 3.5 across several benchmarks. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: TSMC Supplier GlobalWafers Hikes US Spending to $7.5 Billion
item.description: Taiwanese chip materials maker GlobalWafers Co plans to raise its investments in the US to $7.5 billion, sating increasing demand as President Donald Trump tries to boost advanced manufacturing at home.
item.dc:creator: Jane Lanhee Lee

media:content.media:description: HSINCHU, TAIWAN - SEPTEMBER 16: A closeup of a silicon wafer on display at Taiwan Semiconductor Research Institution on September 16, 2022 in Hsinchu, Taiwan. Taiwan's semiconductor manufacturing capabilities are crucial to global supply chains, with megacap companies like Apple, Nvidia and Qualcomm heavily dependent on the island's exports. Taiwan accounts for some 60 percent of global semiconductor foundry revenue, according to media reports. (Photo by Annabelle Chih/Getty Images)

item.title: The Saudis' Bet on AI Plumbing Needs More Plumbers
item.description: Huge plans to become a hub for AI infrastructure could fizzle without enough software innovation and talent.
item.dc:creator: Parmy Olson

media:content.media:description: Elon Musk and Nvidia Corp. CEO Jensen Huang (center) are directed to greet the Saudi crown prince in Riyadh on May 13, 2025.

item.title: ByteDance Aims to Match Meta Sales in 2025 as TikTok Gains Steam
item.description: ByteDance Ltd. is targeting revenue growth of about 20% in 2025 despite a potential global economic downturn, a pace of expansion that could help it match Meta Platforms Inc.’s global business.
item.dc:creator: Zheping Huang, Min Jeong Lee

media:content.media:description: The TikTok logo on a smartphone arranged in the Queens borough of New York, US, on Wednesday, Jan. 15, 2025. The Supreme Court signaled it's likely to uphold a law that would ban the popular TikTok social media platform in the US if it isn't sold by its Chinese parent company by Jan. 19. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg
